definition: (TCM) consumptive disease, chronic deficiency disorder due to impaired function of inner organs, deficiency of qi, blood, yin and yang/asthenia
emptiness/void/abstract theory or guiding principles/empty or unoccupied/diffident or timid/false/humble or modest/(of health) weak/virtual/in vain
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: Enriching consumptive disease, benefiting pneuma, protect lung and tonifying kidney, support healthy energy.
sentences.chinese: 补虚损，益精气，保肺益肾，扶正固本。

definition: disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion
condition characterized by thirst, hunger, frequent urination and weight loss, identified in TCM with type 2 diabetes
deficiency of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
loose bowels/diarrhea/to have the runs
diarrhea
benefit/help

(TCM) "five strains and seven impairments", five referring to the five viscera 五臟|五脏[wu3 zang4], and seven to adverse effects on one's body as a result of: overeating (spleen), anger (liver), moisture (kidney), cold (lung), worry (heart), wind and rain (outer appearance) and fear (mind)
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
uterine bleeding
exhausted/worn out
deficiency of yin 陰|阴[yin1] in TCM
collapse of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
reverse flow of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
stagnation of 氣|气[qi4] (TCM)
an excess of heat caused by a deficiency in Yin energy (idiom)
localized pain disorder (in Chinese medicine)/arthralgia syndrome/bi disorder
sore/skin ulcer
